programme.desc: A mysterious amnesiac helps Yusei build a new engine program for his Runner, but before they can test it out, a make-up-wearing, noodle-eating crook runs off with the file.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's: Get With the Program: Part I
programme.desc: Yusei and the gang trail Lazar to the local mall hoping to reacquire the engine design program that this window-shopping, noodle-eating crook stole from them.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's: Get With the Program: Part II
programme.desc: Yusei and Lazar are trapped in a warehouse where their only chance of escaping is if Yusei can outduel a Guard Bot whose CPU has been uploaded with all of Yusei's battle techniques.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's: Will The Real Jack Atlas, Please Stand Up: Part I
programme.desc: After being charged with crimes he didn't commit, Jack Atlas scrambles to uncover the truth before his friends and fans turn their back on him for good.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's: Will The Real Jack Atlas, Please Stand Up: Part II
programme.desc: With Jack Atlas on the run, Yusei and Crow set out in search of their pal, hoping to clear his good name before bad turns to worse.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's: Mother Knows Best

programme.desc: After being double crossed and sent to the mines by his supposed allies, Yusei hatches a plan to escape. Can Yusei find a way out, or will he and Kalin be forced to work the mines forever?

programme.title: Timber Kings: Living the Dream

programme.title: Timber Kings: Night Sweats

programme.title: World's Greatest: Monuments & Landmarks
programme.desc: Many of the worldâs most significant manmade wonders serve not as dwellings, but as powerful signposts. But more than giving us direction, they tell us a story - they characterize powerful forces, or commemorate power lost.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Coasts
programme.desc: Along coasts, one element ends and another begins. No two days are ever the same on a coastline: the only thing that remains a constant is the timeless power of the sea.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Lost Cities
programme.desc: Once powerful and populous centers of influence, these lost cities are providing clues to how our ancestors existed in the world and remind us that ancient civilizations were not so far removed from our own.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Grassland Animals
programme.desc: Grasslands are the great stages of the natural world where large animals play out spectacular lives in clear view of people, including lions, leopards, elephants, rhinoceros, cheetahs, impalas, kangaroos, wallaby, potoroo, bison, and wolves.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Jungle Animals
programme.desc: Encounter gorillas and orangutans, killer tree-dwelling pythons, delightful monkeys, awe-inspiring tigers, and millions of land-dwelling red crabs in Australia, the islands of Southeast Asia, Africa, and the Amazon.

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur Meets Mister Rogers/Draw!
programme.desc: Mister Rogers is staying at Arthur's house! Mister Rogers is a nice guy, but... his show is for babies! Can Arthur hide the visit from his friends? Next, the trouble starts when Fern draws a not-too-flattering cartoon of Francine.

programme.title: Arthur: Binky Wrestles with a Story/All Will Be Revealed
programme.desc: Binky spends the day with Bitzi Baxter and learns what it's like to be a news reporter. Then, D.W., Bud, and Rapty set out to solve the mystery of what really happened to D.W.'s snowball.

programme.title: Arthur: Room to Ride/The Frensky Family Fiasco
programme.desc: With Lance Armstrongâs support, Binky and his friends take to the streets to convince residents to vote for new bike safety lanes. Francine wants the Frenskys to be closer, but a weekly Family Night turns out to be harder than expected.

programme.title: Arthur: Locked In The Library!/Arthur Accused!
programme.desc: Arthur and Francine are fighting. But when they get locked inside the library they either have to make up or prepare for a long evening. And when Buster opens his detective agency, he has no idea his first job will involve Arthur.

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur's Dummy Disaster/Francine and The Feline
programme.desc: When painfully shy George brings a ventriloquist dummy to school, a popular kid is born! Then, Arthur thinks the best pet to have is a dog, and Francine probably would have agreed--that is, until little Nemo, a cute kitten, came along.

programme.title: Arthur: Elwood City Turns 100!
programme.desc: Arthur and his friends commemorate their 100th episode in style! Mr. Ratburn's class is chosen to stage a musical tribute to Elwood City for its centennial celebration, which quickly becomes a drama behind the curtain!

programme.title: Arthur: For the Birds/Ungifted
programme.desc: Brain dreams of being the first to spot a rare bird species called the green-tailed grebe, making him famous. Arthur and Buster's friendship is put to the test when Arthur gives away a present that Buster had given him for his birthday.

programme.title: Arthur: To Tibble the Truth/Waiting to Go
programme.desc: When the Tibble Twins' constant lying lands them in constant trouble, they promise to tell only the truth. Binky and Brain collide on the soccer field, breaking Brain's new watch and nearly breaking their friendship.

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur's Pet Business/D.W. The Copycat
programme.desc: How can Arthur prove to his parents that he's responsible enough to take care of his very own puppy? "Get a job," suggests D.W.!. Yet another personality change for D.W., who's decided that from now on, she'll be just like Arthur.

programme.title: World War II in HD Color
programme.desc: Allies turn the tide in the Atlantic, where initially German U-Boats harass freely convoys to supply Britain. The route to bring American soldiers who will land on D-Day is clear.

programme.title: World War II in HD Color
programme.desc: Their attack on the Soviet Union having failed, the German Army suffers a series of counter-offensives on the Eastern Front. Wehrmacht's losses are huge as the Soviets advance West.

programme.title: World War II in HD Color
programme.desc: After a careful campaign of disinformation that throws the German defenders off-guard, the Western Allies finally land on Normandy.France is liberated.

programme.title: World War II in HD Color
programme.desc: The Western Allies secure supply routes that will allow them to enter Germany, and the Ardennes counter-offensive fails. The Red Army advances rapidly. The SS implements the Holocaust.

programme.title: World War II in HD Color
programme.desc: The Marines succeed in the "island hopping" strategy against suicidal resistance. The US Navy establishes supremacy, cutting off Japan.
